review.title: A new Recommender system based on target tracking: a Kalman Filter approach
review.abstract: In this paper, we propose a new approach for recommender systems based on target tracking by Kalman filtering. We assume that users and their seen resources are vectors in the multidimensional space of the categories of the resources. Knowing this space, we propose an algorithm based on a Kalman filter to track users and to predict the best prediction of their future position in the recommendation space.

sections.heading: 1 INTRODUCTION
sections.text: For web-based services with dynamic content, recommendation systems face the difficulty of identifying new relevant elements and providing relevant and personalized recommendations to users. Personalized recommendations have become a mandatory feature of websites to improve customer satisfaction and retention. Recommendation methods can be distinguished into two main approaches: content-based filtering (M Pazzani, D. Billsus, 2007) and collaborative filtering (D. Goldberg and al 1992). Collaborative filtering (CF) is one of the most successful and widely used technologies to design recommendation systems. CF analyzes users "ratings to identify similarities between users based on their past ratings, and then generates new recommendations based on like-minded users" preferences. This approach suffers from several disadvantages, such as cold start, latency, thrift (Gras D., this system is an interesting one that we consider as a basis for working in conjunction with the paper).

sections.heading: 1. PRINCIPLES
sections.text: In this part we will describe the main principles of our approach, from the main hypothesis to the theoretical background.

sections.heading: 1.1 Target Tracking in the Cyberspace
sections.text: In this work, we assume that a user is a destination that moves in a particular space, defined by the main categories that describe the resources considered, and that this space, known as the referral space, will have as many dimensions as categories. Figure 1 shows what this path looks like: based on this assumption, we will explain in detail what Kalman filters, how we can apply it in this case, and what our main assumptions are.

sections.heading: 1.2 Kalman filter formulation
sections.text: The basic task of the Kalman filter is to estimate as accurately as possible the position and velocity of a moving object. sections.heading: 2. APPLICATION
sections.text: It is not the first time that the EU Commission has taken such a step.

sections.heading: 2.1 Description of the experiment
sections.text: This experiment is based on television consumption. The data set is the television consumption of 6423 English households over a period of 6 months (from September 1, 2008 to March 1, 2009) (Broadcaster Audience Research Board), (Senot, C. and al, 2010). This data set contains information about the user, the household and the television program. Each television program is characterized by one or more genres. In the experiment, a user profile is created for each person. The user profile is the set of genres associated with the user's interest in each genre. This user profile is worked out depending on the quality of a user's television consumption: When a television program is watched in full, the genre associated with that TV program increases in the user profile. Several logical rules are applied to estimate the user's interest in a television program. The methodology of the experiment is as follows: Each user profile is calculated at different times (35) from the television data. sections.heading: 3. Numerical results
sections.text: The obtained results can be represented as follows: Kalman filter predicts the interest of a certain user in a gender that knows its past. With this prediction, we can suggest a new recommendation strategy: If the quantity of interest (QoI) of the user is predicted to be located in a certain region of the room, we can recommend something within that particular region: For example, if the specific region is defined by the dimensions documentary and drama, we can recommend content that is related to these two dimensions. If the predicted quantity of interest (QoI) changes to another dimension of the room, we can automatically recommend content from this new region of the room. In the following figures (3 to 6) we can see the assessment / prediction given by the Kalman filter. The green lines show the prediction that is made each time using knowledge of the degree of interest of each user. sections.heading: 4. RECOMMANDATION PROCEDURE
sections.text: In this approach we can make a recommendation by analyzing the estimate through Kalman filters.The profile is built from the consumption of TV programs. Each TV program is defined by concepts such as entertainment, science fiction, talk show, etc.. Analyzing the way in which different TV programs are viewed allows to derive the interest of a user for each concept.This point moves at any other time in space and thus forms a path. With the Kalman filter we estimate the next position of the user profil.The estimate shows the evolution within the concepts (in our case, 44 dimensions).This point moves in the environment and forms a path.

sections.heading: 4 CONCLUSIONS
sections.text: In this essay, the main idea is to take into account that the one who selects films as the target moves along a trajectory in the receiving space. The receiving space is considered as 44-dimensional space, based on the main concepts that describe the films. Then, the position of the target is measured by the interest index expressed for each concept. Then, the Kalman filter applied with the help of a tracking model predicts the "positions" in the receiving space.If the user then knows the user's previous positions in that space along the different axis of 44-dimensional space, our Kalman-based receiving system suggests: If the user is interested in contents of types x, y and z, and if he has already seen contents of type x and y on that day, the recommendation would essentially focus on contents of the type that knows the position in the space, the best prediction for his next positions in the receiving space, i.e. his best interest space is to follow the content of type x and y that day, the recommendation would focus on contents of the type that knows the position in the space, the best prediction for his next positions in the receiving space, i.e. his best interest space is to keep the focus on the specific content of the target in the index he is accustomed to.
